case_title: In Re: REQUEST OF MR. RIAZ AHMED SIPRA, SECRETARY/ MEMBER, FEDERAL ANTI CORRUPTION COMMITTEE FOR SUPPLY OF COPY OF STATEMENT OF ASSETS AND LIABILITIES OF MIAN MUHAMMAD NAWAZ SHARIF, M.NA.
appellant: Mr. Riaz Ahmed Sipra, Secretary/Member, Federal Anti-Corruption Committee

accussed_details.name: Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif
allegation: Filing false statement of assets and liabilities
Corrupt practices under Section 78 of the Representation of the People Act, 1976

complaint_summary: Application filed by Mr. Riaz Ahmed Sipra requesting a copy of the statement of assets and liabilities of Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif under subsection (3A) of Section 42 of the Representation of the People Act, 1976. Allegation of false statement constituting corrupt practices and disqualification under Article 63(2) of the Constitution.
investigation_summary: Federal Anti-Corruption Committee sought the document to move a reference to the Speaker under Article 63(2) of the Constitution, alleging false statements in the respondent's assets declaration.
judgment_summary: The application was dismissed on the grounds that the Federal Anti-Corruption Committee lacked locus standi to request the document. The court held that the committee was not authorized by the Prime Minister's Order of 1987 to investigate members of Parliament or refer matters to the Speaker under Article 63(2). The court emphasized that statements of assets and liabilities are public documents but cannot be accessed by entities without legal standing.
legal_arguments: Applicant argued that any person could request a copy of public documents under Article 87 of Qanun-e-Shahadat.
Defense argued that the Federal Anti-Corruption Committee lacked authority under the Prime Minister's Order of 1987 to request such documents.
Defense cited Articles 4 and 25 of the Constitution, emphasizing the respondent's right to equal protection under the law.
assets: Statement of assets and liabilities of Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif
sections: Section 42(3A) of the Representation of the People Act, 1976
Section 78 of the Representation of the People Act, 1976
key_issues: Locus standi of the Federal Anti-Corruption Committee
Access to public documents under Qanun-e-Shahadat
Authority of the Chief Election Commissioner to grant access to statements of assets and liabilities

maxims.Nemo dat quod non habet: No one can give what they do not have.

legal_terms.Locus Standi: The right or capacity to bring an action or to appear in a court.

words_and_phrases.Corrupt Practices: Actions defined under Section 78 of the Representation of the People Act, 1976.

summary_vector_notes: Application dismissed due to lack of locus standi of the Federal Anti-Corruption Committee. Court emphasized that public documents like statements of assets and liabilities cannot be accessed without legal authority.
